JobFullDesc: The Intelligence and Space Mission Area Systems Engineering Team is looking for a Mission Management/Mission Planning Systems Engineer to support the CSS program.  You will support the accomplishment of engineering tasks in an iterative development environment. You will provide technical direction and clarification of requirements to software agile development teams, integration and test personnel, performs system engineering analyses including trade studies, use case development, requirements definition and derivation, interface definition, and requirement validation and verification and supports planning / development and interfaces with personnel from other organizations. The Systems Engineer will attend technical interchange meetings with the team members and other program personnel, and represents the organization in matters pertaining to the development of their project, provides status on assigned Integrated Master Schedule (IMS) tasks as needed and provides document review and resolves technical systems engineering and integration issues.  Additionally the Systems Engineer supports ECP efforts. In additional to program efforts the candidate may be asked to support various proposal efforts.  This candidate must have the ability to manage time and resources in order to meet assigned deadlines. OR  Master’s Degree from an accredited University – Preferred Degree in STEM in Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics, or related STEM Degree Program  with 8+ years’ of relevant experience Benefits offered: medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short-term disability, long-term disability, 401(k) match, flexible spending accounts, EAP, education assistance, parental leave, paid time off, and holidays“In compliance with Colorado’s Equal Pay for Equal Work Act, the salary range for this role is $106,500 to $223,500; however, Raytheon Technologies considers several factors when extending an offer, including but not limited to, the role and associated responsibilities, a candidate’s work experience, education/training, and key skills.”
